title: How to Clean Bare Minerals Makeup Brushes

steps.headline: Gather the necessary materials.
steps.description: You'll need baby shampoo, a towel, and a sink with running water.

steps.headline: Wet the bristles of the brush with water.
steps.description: Make sure not to let the water seep into the handle, or it will loosen the glue and ruin the brush.

steps.headline: Squeeze a small amount of baby shampoo onto the brush.
steps.description: Massage it through the bristles, then rinse the brush. Do this two times (or as many times as needed) to get rid of all the product in the bristles and ensure that it's clean.

steps.headline: Lay your brushes out on a towel to dry.

text: Gather the necessary materials. You'll need baby shampoo, a towel, and a sink with running water. Wet the bristles of the brush with water. Make sure not to let the water seep into the handle, or it will loosen the glue and ruin the brush. Squeeze a small amount of baby shampoo onto the brush. Massage it through the bristles, then rinse the brush. Do this two times (or as many times as needed) to get rid of all the product in the bristles and ensure that it's clean. Lay your brushes out on a towel to dry.
